title: Sprint 01: PHP Foundations & Flow
description: Granular refresh of PHP's building blocks, focusing on memory model, type system nuances, and functional paradigms for seniors.
items: 01- Variable Scopes & References: Local, Global, Static internals, Memory assignment vs Value assignment (&$var)
02- Primitive Types & Math: Integer overflow, Float precision (BCMath), Strings, Unicode handling
03- Type System: Strict Types (declare(strict_types=1)), Casting, Type Juggling implications
04- Null Handling: Coalescing (??), Null Safe (?->), isset vs empty vs is_null distinctions
05- Constants & Superglobals: const vs define(), Magic constants (__DIR__), Safe usage of $_SERVER/$_ENV
06- Control Structures: Match expression vs Switch (Strictness), Generators (yield), loops optimization
07- Function Power: Named Arguments, Variadics (...$args), Default values, Argument unpacking
08- Modern Return Types: Union Types (A|B), Intersection Types (A&B), void, never (PHP 8.1)
09- Anonymous Functions: Closures, 'use' keyword, Arrow Functions (fn) scope capturing
10- Array Architectures: Associative vs Indexed performance, Destructuring (list/[]), Spread operator
11- Functional Array Methods: Deep dive into array_map, array_filter, array_reduce usage
12- Application Sorting: User-defined sorts (usort), Spaceship operator (<=>) for comparisons
13- SPL Data Structures: SplFixedArray, SplQueue, SplStack for performance optimization
14- File Inclusion: Autoloading mechanics (pre-Composer), include vs require safety macros
15- Garbage Collection: Basics of reference counting, cyclic references, and memory management
